title: 1357-A7
statement: A7. Distinguish Y, XZ, -Y and -XZtime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given an operation that implements a single-qubit unitary transformation: either the Y gate (possibly with an extra global phase of $$$-1$$$) or the sequence of Pauli Z and Pauli X gates (the Z gate applied first and the X gate applied second; possibly with an extra global phase of $$$-1$$$). processed.result:
You are given a quantum operation that acts on a single qubit. This operation can be one of four types:

*  Y gate (possibly with an extra global phase of $-1$)
*  Sequence of Z gate followed by X gate (possibly with an extra global phase of $-1$)

Each of these operations has two variants:

*  Adjoint: The operation reversed in time.
*  Controlled: The operation applied only if a second qubit is in the state $|1\rangle$.

Your task is to figure out which of the four operations was used. You can apply the given operation and its variants (adjoint and controlled) at most three times.

You need to write a program that takes the quantum operation as input and outputs an integer representing the type of operation used:

*  0 for the Y gate
*  1 for the $-XZ$ gate
*  2 for the $-Y$ gate
*  3 for the $XZ$ gate

You are given a special operation that can be applied to a single unit of data. This operation can be one of four types. You need to figure out which type of operation was used by applying it and its variations a maximum of three times.  You must output a number (0, 1, 2, or 3) representing the type of operation.
